sentences.english: It is the most envied outfit in television, and one of the most profitable.
sentences.chinese: 它们是最令人艳羡的电视机构，也是最赚钱的一家。

sentences.english: Making dead wood more blest than living lips.
sentences.chinese: 使枯木比活嘴唇更值得艳羡。

sentences.english: However, the short-lived and that people often envy of the one-meter glory.
sentences.chinese: 但是，短暂的往往是那让人艳羡的一米辉煌。

sentences.english: The German county's resident expressed that admires to Barnet's fortuitous encounter.
sentences.chinese: 德文郡的居民则表示对巴尼特的奇遇艳羡不已。

sentences.english: Men want to be trusted and admired.
sentences.chinese: 男人希望获得别人的信任和艳羡。

definition: to admire/to hold in high esteem
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to water at the mouth/to drool
to raise eyebrows/to cast sidelong glances (expressing fear or indignation)/shocked/surprised
to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
to yearn for/to look forward to
